page.title: List of burial places of biblical figures

revision.text:
The following is a list of burial places attributed to Biblical personalities according to various religious and local traditions. The locations listed are not based on factual evidence, but rather locations mentioned in the text of the Bible or oral traditions of indigenous peoples. [[Lebanon]], [[Israel]], the [[Palestinian territories]], [[Iraq]], [[Jordan]] and [[Iran]] have put monuments on the grave locations in an attempt to preserve them as holy sites. Many sites have been transmitted from generation to generation and there are historical accounts from travellers which state their existence. ==Figures mentioned in the [[Tanakh#Torah|Torah]]== {|class="toccolours" border="1" cellpadding="8" |- ! style="width:15%;"|Biblical figure ! style="width:25%;"|Place name and location ! style="width:10%;"|Image ! style="width:50%;"|Notes |- |[[Adam]] |Judaism: [[Cave of the Patriarchs]], [[Hebron]], West Bank, Christianity: Chapel of Adam, [[Church of the Holy Sepulchre]], Sunni Islam: [[Cave of the Patriarchs]], [[Hebron]], West Bank, Shia Islam: [[Imam Ali Mosque]], [[Najaf]], [[Iraq]] |[[File:Hebron001.JPG|100px]]

[[File:Meshed_ali_usnavy_(PD).jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Eve]] |Judaism: [[Cave of the Patriarchs]], [[Hebron]], West Bank, Islam: [[Tomb of Eve]], [[Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia]] |[[File:Hebron001.JPG|100px]]
[[File:Eves-tomb-pelerinage-a-la-mecque-et-a-medina.png|100px]] | |- |[[Cain and Abel|Abel]] |[[Nabi Habeel Mosque]], [[Zabadani|Zabadani Valley]], [[Syria]] |[[File:NabiHabeel01.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Seth]] |In Judaism: [[Tiberias]], [[Israel]] In Islam: [[Al-Nabi Shayth]], [[Lebanon]],
[[Bashshit]] |[[File:Bashshit.jpg|100px]]
[[File:Seth_Prophet_Shrine_in_Seth_Prophet_Town01.JPG|100px]] | |- |[[Noah]] |There are several sites that are claimed to be the Tomb of Noah: * [[Noah’s Mausoleum (Nakhchivan, Azerbaijan)|Tomb of Noah]] (Islam), [[Nakhichivan Autonomous Republic|Nakhichevan]], exclave of [[Azerbaijan]]. * [https://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2006/07/060705-noahs-ark.html Damavand], [[Iran]] * [[Imam Ali Mosque]] (Shia Islam), [[Najaf]], [[Iraq]] * [[Jordan]] * [[Karak Nuh]], [[Lebanon]] * [[Cizre]], [[Turkey]]
{{see also|Tomb of Noah}} | [[File:The grave monument of the prophet Noah.JPG|100px]] [[File:Meshed ali usnavy (PD).jpg|100px]] [[File:Tomb of prophet Noah.jpg|100px]] [[File:Gora Nûh Cizîra Botan 2009 2.JPG|100px]] | |- |[[Abraham]], [[Sarah]], [[Isaac]], [[Rebecca]], [[Jacob]], [[Esau]] and [[Leah]] |[[Cave of the Patriarchs]], [[Hebron]], West Bank |[[File:Hebron001.JPG|100px]] |According to Jewish tradition, only [[Esau]]'s head is buried in the [[Cave of the Patriarchs]]. According to legends, [[Ishmael]] was buried here as well.{{Citation needed|date=December 2008}} |- |[[Ishmael]] and [[Hagar]] |Islam: [[Hajr Ismail]], [[Mecca]], [[Saudi Arabia]]{{cite book | last = Corbin | first = Henry | title = Temple and Contemplation | year = 2009 | month = | publisher = [[Roudledge]] | location = [[London]] | isbn = 978-0-710-30129-1 | page = 227 | chapter = The configuration of the Temple of the Ka´bah. | quote = "This is the ''hijr'' of Ishmael, or the house of Ishmael (''Bayt Ismail''), where he buried his mother Hagar and where he himself is buried." }} |[[File:Last call for Hajis - Flickr - Al Jazeera English.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Lot (biblical person)|Lot]] |Islam: [[Bani Na'im]], near Hebron, [[West Bank]] |[http://www.islamichistoryandtravel.com/PALBNDSC_0560%20(1).jpg Seen here]. | |- |[[Rachel]] |[[Rachel's Tomb]], outside [[Bethlehem]], West Bank |[[File:TOMB-GATE.JPG|100px]] | |- |[[Zilpah]], [[Bilhah]] [[Jochebed]], [[Zipporah]], and [[Elisheva]] |[[Tomb of the Matriarchs]], [[Tiberias]], Israel |[[File:Matriarch_graves_1.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Reuben (Bible)|Reuben]] |[[Nabi Rubin]], [[Palmachim]], [[Israel]] |[[File:Reuben's tomb.jpg|100px]] |During the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman period]] Arabs would gather each year at the [[Mamluk]]-era structure. Nowadays, infrequent Jewish visitors come to pray at the site. |- |[[Judah (Bible)|Judah]] |[[Yehud]], [[Israel]][http://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-614070,00.html האבות, האמהות, הבנים והנביאים] |[[File:The_Tomb_of_Judah_Jacob's_Son_ap_003.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Simeon (Hebrew Bible)|Simeon]] |[[Eyal|Kibbutz Eyal]], [[Israel]]. |[[File:Tomb-of-simeon-50.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Asher]] and [[Naphtali]] |[[Tel Kedesh]] near [[Malkia]], [[Israel]] |[http://www.thirdtemple.com/TribesOfIsrael/AsherNaftali/AherPhotoLrg/Asher2.JPG Seen here]. | |- |[[Gad (son of Jacob)|Gad]] |Nevei Ganda, in [[Rehovot]], Israel, or Ain Al-Jadur, west of [[Salt, Jordan]] (pictured) |[https://www.google.com/maps/place/Prophet+Jadur+Shrine+%D9%85%D9%82%D8%A7%D9%85+%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%A8%D9%8A+%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%88%D8%B1%E2%80%AD/@32.0329885,35.7261477,3a,75y/data=!3m8!1e2!3m6!1sAF1QipPU2vYCjGsswROqUtXJyPBbxqtS7-nkVez9EUwx!2e10!3e12!6shttps:%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipPU2vYCjGsswROqUtXJyPBbxqtS7-nkVez9EUwx%3Dw203-h270-k-no!7i640!8i853!4m5!3m4!1s0x151cbd4693afbd25:0xe68f9b4130915e83!8m2!3d32.0332546!4d35.7310709 Seen here] | |- |[[Dan (Bible)|Dan]] |[[Beit Shemesh]], [[Israel]][https://archive.is/20130107234536/www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=311 דן בן יעקב] |[http://www.attractions-in-israel.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/IMG_6485.jpg Seen here] | |- |[[Qedarite]] |[[Zanjan, Iran]] |[[File:Gidar.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Zebulun]] |Tomb of Zebulun, [[Sidon]], [[Lebanon]] |[https://web.archive.org/web/20180608212952/http://archive.diarna.org/uploads/icons/03_TombOfZevulunExteriorEntrance.jpg Seen here]. |In the past, towards the end of [[Iyyar]], Jews from the most distant parts of Palestine and the Jews who lived in Lebanon would make a pilgrimage to this tomb.[http://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?letter=P&artid=314#1192 Pilgrimage in Palestine] |- |[[Joseph (Hebrew Bible)|Joseph]], [[Ephraim]] and [[Manasseh (tribal patriarch)|Manasseh]] |Judaism: [[Joseph's Tomb]], [[Nablus]] (Shechem), West Bank; Islam: [[Cave of the Patriarchs]], [[Hebron]], West Bank, |[[File:Joseph's Tomb.jpg|100px]] |Some others consider Joseph to have been buried next to the Cave of the Patriarchs, where a mediaeval structure known as the kalah (castle) is now located. Some archaeologists believe that the site in Nablus is a few centuries old and could contain the remains of a Muslim sheikh named Yusef Al-Dwaik. |- |[[Benjamin]] |[[Kfar Saba]], [[Israel]] |[[File:Nabi-Yamin-50.jpg|100px]]
[[File:Nabi-Yamin-41.jpg|100px]] |Two structures 30 m away from each other (both pictured) are each claimed by Jews and Muslims as the authentic tomb. This site is questionable, however, because it is not located in the territory of the Tribe of Benjamin.{{Citation needed|date=April 2008}} |- |[[Serah]] |[[Pir-i Bakran]], near [[Esfahan]], [[Iran]]{{cite book | last = Goldman | first = Shalom | title = The Wiles of Women, The Wiles of Men | year = 1995 | month = | publisher = [[SUNY Press]] | location = [[New York City|New York]] | isbn = 0-7914-2683-1 | page = 115 | chapter = The Women of the Joseph Story | quote = }} |[[File:Serah_bat_Asher_cemetery%2C_Pir_Bakran.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Moses]] |[[Mount Nebo (Jordan)]] |[[File:Dead Sea from Mt Nebo.jpg|100px]] |According to the Bible, the exact place of Moses' grave remains unknown, in order to impede idolatry. |- |[[Aaron]] |[[Tomb of Aaron]]: [[Mount Hor|Mount Harun]] near [[Petra]], Jordan. |[[File:Shrine on Mt Aaron.jpg|100px]] |At 1350 meters above sea-level, it is the highest peak in the area; it is believed to be the place where Aaron died and was buried. A 14th-century mosque stands here with its white dome visible from most areas in and around Petra. |- |[[Eleazar]] and [[Ithamar]] |[[Awarta]], West Bankhttps://archive.is/20130108023424/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=337 אלעזר בן אהרן הכהן |[[File:קברי אלעזר ואיתמר בגבעת פינחס (עוורתא).JPG|100px]] |Due to the uncertain security situation, the Israel Defense Forces limits visits by Jews to one annual night close to the 5th of Shevat on the Hebrew calendar (around January–February). {{Citation needed|date=July 2014}} |- |- |[[Jethro (Bible)|Jethro]] |[[Nabi Shu'ayb]], [[Hittin]] |[[File:Nebishoaib.jpg|100px]] |Each year on April 25, the Druze gather at the site to discuss community affairs.[http://www.druzehistoryandculture.com/historical_sites.htm Druze Revered Sites in Palestine: Jethro's Tomb] |- |[[Aholiab]] |Sujod, [[Southern Lebanon]][http://www.tevuot.org/aretz/3k.html נחלת אשר] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070312202752/http://www.tevuot.org/aretz/3k.html |date=2007-03-12 }} | [https://plus.google.com/photos/photo/105444568569447390878/6455874564252776114 Seen here] |Located at [https://www.google.com/maps/place/33%C2%B026'34.1%22N+35%C2%B032'17.2%22E/@33.4428,35.5381,734m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x0!8m2!3d33.4428!4d35.5381 33.4428°N 35.5381°E] |} ==Figures mentioned in the [[Tanakh|Nevi'im]] (Prophets)== {|class="toccolours" border="1" cellpadding="8" |- ! style="width:15%;"|Biblical figure ! style="width:25%;"|Place name and location ! style="width:10%;"|Image ! style="width:50%;"|Notes |- |[[Nun (Bible)|Nun]] |[[Timnath-heres]], attributed to [[Kifl Hares]], [[Salfit Governorate]], [[West Bank]] |[[File:Nun2.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Joshua]] |[[Timnath-heres]], attributed to [[Kifl Hares]], [[Salfit Governorate]], [[West Bank]], also [http://isfahanology.com/?page_id=54 Historical cemetery of Takht e Foolad in Esfahan, Iran] |[[File:Joshua's Tomb at Kifl Hares.jpg|100px]] |Thousands make the pilgrimage to his tomb on the [[Jahrtzeit|annual commemoration of his death]], 26th of [[Nisan]] on the [[Hebrew calendar]]. |- |[[Caleb]] |[[Timnath-heres]], attributed to [[Kifl Hares]], [[Salfit Governorate]], [[West Bank]] |[[File:Caleb2.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Othniel Ben Kenaz]] |[[Hebron]], West Bank[http://www.hebron.com/english/article.php?id=280 Otniel ben Knaz] |[https://web.archive.org/web/20180608213915/http://en.hebron.org.il/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/otniel%20ben%20knaz%20IMG_2340_0.jpg?itok=vrjMLGgj Seen here] | |- |[[Shamgar]] |[[Tebnine]], [[Lebanon]][http://www.yeshiva.org.il/midrash/shiur.asp?id=3032 Yeshiva.org.il - המשך ענין לבנון] |[[File:View_from_the_Toron_castle,_Lebanon.jpg|100px]] |No pictures of the tomb currently exist. The tomb itself can be found at [https://tools.wmflabs.org/geohack/geohack.php?pagename=Tomb_of_Shamgar¶ms=33.198306_N_35.421694_E_region:IL_type:landmark_source:placeopedia 33°11'53.9"N 35°25'18.1"E] |- |[[Deborah]], [[Barak]] and [[Yael]] |[[Kedesh|Tel Kaddesh]], [[Israel]][https://archive.is/20130108045143/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=328 מקומות קדושים | קברי צדיקים - הגליל העליון ואצבע הגליל - גבול לבנון - ברק בן אבינעם - SYT] |[[File:Barak devorah.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Samson]] |[[Beit Shemesh]], [[Israel]][https://archive.is/20130111160655/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=312 שמשון הגיבור] |[[File:PikiWiki Israel 9777 samson amp; his father graves in tel zorah.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Elkanah (husband of Hannah)|Elkanah]] |Kedita, [[Upper Galilee]], [[Israel]][http://www.zadikim.co.il/scripts/sit.dll?language=Heb&kind=SiteInfo&id=56&in=1 אלקנה] |[http://www.zissil.com/images/0/05/00000213-tomb-elkana-the-prophet.jpg See here] | |- |[[Hannah (Bible)|Hannah]] and [[Samuel (Bible)|Samuel]] |[[Tomb of Samuel]], [[West Bank]].[https://archive.is/20130108032613/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=186 מקומות קדושים | קברי צדיקים - ירושלים - צפון ירושלים - שמואל הנביא - SYT] Other sources claim Samuel's tomb is located 30 km outside [[Saveh City]], [[Iran]]. |[[File:NebiSamuel2.jpg|100px]] |Both Jewish and Muslim prayers are held at the tomb. Many religious Jews visit the tomb on the 28th of Iyar, the anniversary of Samuel the Prophet's death. |- |[[Eli (biblical figure)|Eli]] |[[Shilo, Mateh Binyamin|Shiloh]], [[Samaria]] |[[File:עלי_הכהן.jpg|100px]] |According to Jewish tradition the [[Yahrzeit]] of Eli the Cohen is on [[w:he:י' באייר|י' באייר]] — the [[Iyar#Iyar in Jewish history|tenth day of Iyar]]. |- |[[David]] |[[David's Tomb]], [[Mount Zion]], Jerusalem |[[File:King david tomb.jpg|100px]] |{{Bibleref2|1 Kings 2:10}} says that King David was buried in his own city; the [[City of David]] is on the southeastern hill of Jerusalem, Mount Zion is its western hill. The "tomb" is a [[Crusades|Crusader]]-era [[cenotaph]] (symbolical, empty [[sarcophagus]]). The building dates to the 2nd century CE the earliest, and the tradition of David being buried here was created by Byzantine Christians well over a millennium after his supposed death.{{cite book |title=The Holy Land: An Oxford Archaeological Guide from Earliest Times to 1700 |series=Oxford Archaeological Guides |author=Jerome Murphy-O'Connor |year=2008 |location=Oxford |publisher=Oxford University Press |pages=116–117 |isbn=978-0-19-923666-4 |quote= |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=cSuErBFmykQC&pg=PA117&dq=%22Beneath+the+present+floor+of+the+Tomb+of+David%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjDms7__8zOAhXK7RQKHQQlCIoQ6AEIHDAA#v=onepage&q=%22Beneath%20the%20present%20floor%20of%20the%20Tomb%20of%20David%22&f=false |accessdate=19 August 2016 }} |- |[[Absalom]] |[[Yad Avshalom]], [[Mount of Olives]], [[Jerusalem]] |[[File:Tomb of Avshalom in the Kidron Valley;.jpg|100px]] |Archaeologists have dated the tomb to the first century CE. Its association with Absalom only dates from the 12th century.{{cite book |title=The Holy Land: An Oxford Archaeological Guide from Earliest Times to 1700 |series=Oxford Archaeological Guides |author=Jerome Murphy-O'Connor |year=2008 |location=Oxford |publisher=Oxford University Press |page=133 |isbn=978-0-19-923666-4 |quote= |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=cSuErBFmykQC&pg=PA133&dq=%22The+bottle-shaped+top+of+%E2%80%98Absalom%E2%80%99s+Monument%E2%80%99%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjCptyFgc3OAhXEcRQKHYACBz0Q6AEIHDAA#v=onepage&q=%22The%20bottle-shaped%20top%20of%20%E2%80%98Absalom%E2%80%99s%20Monument%E2%80%99%22&f=false |accessdate=19 August 2016 }} Currently it is not considered by any religious group to be the tomb of Absalom, due to its age (1000 years too recent) and the Bible ({{Bibleref2|2 Samuel 18:17}}, which says Absalom's body was covered over with stones in a pit in the forest of Ephraim). |- |[[Abner|Abner ben Ner]] |[[Hebron]], West Bank[http://hebron.web.aplus.net/english/article.php?id=240 Tomb of Avner ben Ner (Abner) in Hebron] |[[File:Abner ben Ner.jpg|100px]] |Rabbi [[Moses ben Mordecai Bassola|Moses Basola]] visited the tomb in 1522.{{Cite book|title = In Zion and Jerusalem: The Itinerary of Rabbi Moses Basola 1512-1523|url = https://www.amazon.com/In-Zion-Jerusalem-Itinerary-1512-1523/dp/9652229261|publisher = C G Gundation|date = 1999-12-31|location = Jerusalem|isbn = 9789652229267|first = David|last = Avraham}} Sefer Yihus ha-Tzaddiqim (Book of Genealogy of the Righteous), a collection of travel writings first published in 1561, mentions the tomb.{{Cite web|title = URI (ORI) BEN SIMEON - JewishEncyclopedia.com|url = http://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/articles/14604-uri-ori-ben-simeon|website = www.jewishencyclopedia.com|accessdate = 2016-01-04}} |- |[[Isaiah]] |[[Isaiah mausoleum]], [[Esfahan]], [[Iran]]Freedman, Warren. (1984) ''World Guide for the Jewish Traveler''. NY: E.P. Dutton Inc or Nahal Dishon, (Israel) |[[File:Emamzadeh Esmaeil.jpg|100px]]
[[File:Tomb of isaiah.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Hushai]] |[[Yirka]], [[Israel]] | | |- |[[Iddo (prophet)|Iddo]] |[[Golan Heights]],[http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=299 עידו הנביא] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080330031918/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=299 |date=2008-03-30 }} | | |- |[[Jehoshaphat]] |[[Mount of Olives]], [[Jerusalem]] [https://archive.is/20130108040825/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=299 יהושפט] |[http://www.templeseeker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/Cave-of-J.jpg Seen here.] | |- |[[Elisha]] |Elisha's Tomb. Disputed between: near Mt. Carmel, [[West Bank]] or [[Kfar Yassif]] near [[Acre (city)|Acre]], Israel |[http://muslimprophets.com/img/prophet/elisha1.jpg Seen here] | |- |[[Huldah]] |[[Mount of Olives]], [[Jerusalem]] |[http://allaboutjerusalem.com/sites/default/files/imagecache/big-image-gallery/ifa_upload/Raba-ah_Al-Ouidaya_Nun_Palgiya_Antiyocha.jpg Seen here] | |- |[[Zedekiah]] |Cave of Zedekiah, [[Old City of Jerusalem]] [https://archive.is/20130107233637/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=565 מקומות קדושים | קברי צדיקים - ירושלים - העיר העתיקה - מערת צדקיהו - SYT] |[[File:Zedekiah's_Cave_in_summer_2011_(2).JPG|100px]] | |- |[[Ezekiel]] |[[Ezekiel's Tomb]], [[Al Kifl]], [[Iraq]] |[[File:Ezekial's-Tomb-at-Kifel.jpg|100px]] |Up till the mid-20th century, up to 5,000 Jews used to come to the tomb during [[Passover]].[http://jewishrefugees.blogspot.com/2006/04/passover-pilgrimage-to-ezekiels-tomb.html Passover pilgrimage to Ezekiel's tomb in Iraq ] Muslims believe this tomb to be that of an unspecified personality named [[Dhul-Kifl]]. ''(For an image of the tomb, see:http://www.johnberger.com/indexdead2.htm)'' This site was protected under the control of [[Saddam Hussein]]. |- |[[Baruch ben Neriah]] |[[Al Kifl]], [[Iraq]] |[[File:Kifl_Harith_2.jpg|100px]] |Exact location unknown. According to tradition Baruch's tomb is located about {{convert|1|mi|km|sing=on}} away from [[Ezekiel's Tomb]] near a town called "Mashhad Ali" which there is no record of ever existing. Another claim postulated by the source of some legends regarding the location of the tomb places the structure four [[parasangs]] away from the Tomb of Ezra while still maintaining its location a mile from the Tomb of Ezekiel, despite the tombs of Ezra and Ezekiel being close to 51 parasangs apart. |- |[[Hosea]] |Ancient Jewish cemetery of [[Safed]], Israel[http://www.mytzadik.com/tadik.asp?kever_id=59&safaid=6 הושע הנביא] |[[File:Hosea's tomb.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Amittai]] |[[Beit Ummar]], near Hebron, West Bank |[https://web.archive.org/web/20180608215438/https://i.pinimg.com/originals/30/5b/6d/305b6d7d1643996d3c801ab4c7bbef82.jpg Seen here] |Mosque of Nabi Matta: The main mosque in Beit Ummar housing the tomb of Nabi Matta or Amittai, father of Jonah. [[Mujir al-Din al-'Ulaymi|Mujir ad-Din]] writes that Matta was "a holy man from the people of the house of the prophecy." Nearby Halhul houses the tomb of Jonah with the inscription reading "Yunus ibn Matta" or "Jonah son of Amittai", confirming that Matta is indeed the Arabic name for Amittai and the Beit Ummar tomb is dedicated to Amittai. In 1226, the Ayyubid sultan al-Mu'azzam built a mosque with a minaret under the supervision of Jerusalem governor Rashid ad-Din al-Mu'azzami. The Mamluks constructed some additions to the mosque and engraved several inscriptions on its surface. |- |[[Jonah]] |Judaism: [[Mashhad, Israel]]. ''(pictured)'' Islam: [[Halhul]], near Beit Ummar, Hebron. |
[[File:Neby_Yunis.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Micah (prophet)|Micah]] |[[Kabul, Israel]][https://archive.is/20130108005816/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=137 מיכה הנביא] |[[File:Profet_Micah_Tomb_in_Kabul_Israel_1.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Nahum]] |Al Qush, south of [[Dahuk, Iraq]]. There are however two other sites mentioned in historical accounts: Elkesi, near Ramah in the [[Galilee]] and Elcesei in the [[West Bank]][http://www.tombofnahum.com/index.htm Renovation- Al Qush Synagogue and the Tomb of Nahum] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120211085524/http://www.tombofnahum.com/index.htm |date=2012-02-11 }}. |[[File:ProphetNahum.JPG|100px]] | |- |[[Habakkuk]] |Some locate it at [[Huqoq]], others at [[Kadarim]], [[Israel]].[http://www.mytzadik.com/tadik.asp?kever_id=58&safaid=6 חבקוק הנביא] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111001191329/http://www.mytzadik.com/tadik.asp?kever_id=58&safaid=6 |date=2011-10-01 }}[http://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=954&letter=H Hukkok] Others at [[Toyserkan]], [[Iran]].[http://www.toyserkan.com/album/Hayaghoogh/ آلبوم عکسهای تویسرکان] |[[File:CHUKUK01.JPG|100px]]
[[File:Prophet Habakkuk Tomb ap 001.jpg|100px]]
[[File:Habakuk mausoleum Tuyserkan Iran.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Zephaniah]] |[[Mazraat el-Btadiniye|En-Nabi Safi]], [[Southern Lebanon]][http://www.yeshiva.org.il/midrash/shiur.asp?id=3032 המשך ענין לבנון] |[[File:Mazraat el Chouf.jpg|100px]] |No pictures of the tomb currently exist. The tomb itself can be found at [https://tools.wmflabs.org/geohack/geohack.php?pagename=Tomb_of_Zephaniah¶ms=33.4761_N_35.5328_E_region:IL_type:landmark_source:placeopedia 33°28'34.0"N 35°31'58.1"E] |- |[[Haggai]], [[Malachi]], and [[Zechariah (Hebrew prophet)|Zechariah]] |[[Tomb of the Prophets Haggai, Zechariah and Malachi|Tomb of the Prophets]], [[Mount of Olives]], [[Jerusalem]] [https://archive.is/20130108015420/http://www.syt.co.il/showKever.asp?id=287 חגי הנביא] |[[File:Tomb of the Prophets entrance 2.jpg|100px]] | |- |} ==Figures mentioned in the [[Tanakh|Ketuvim]] (Writings)== {|class="toccolours" border="1" cellpadding="8" |- ! style="width:15%;"|Biblical figure ! style="width:25%;"|Place name and location ! style="width:10%;"|Image ! style="width:50%;"|Notes |- |[[Job (Bible)|Job]] |In [[Druze|Druzism]]: [[Chouf District]], [[Lebanon]] ''(pictured)''. [[Yaqut al-Hamawi]] recorded that it was located in [[Al-Shaykh Saad]], while another tradition locates it at [[Salalah]], [[Oman]] |[[File:Lebanon the rest 115.jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Jesse]] and [[Ruth (biblical figure)|Ruth]] |[[Hebron]], West Bank |[[File:The tomb of Jesse and Ruth (7705253158).jpg|100px]] | |- |[[Mordecai]] and [[Esther]] |[[Tomb of Esther and Mordechai]], [[Hamedan]], [[Iran]] |[[File:Tomb of Ester and Mordechai interior.jpg|100px]] |[[Persian Jews]] still make annual pilgrimage in honor of the Purim festival. |- |[[Daniel (biblical figure)|Daniel]] |[[Tomb of Daniel]], [[Susa]], [[Iran]] ''(pictured)''. There are however six other traditional sites including [[Kirkuk]] in [[Iraq]] and [[Samarkand]] in [[Uzbekistan]] |[[File:Daniel Barry Kent.JPG|100px]] | At the site in Kirkuk, the locals claim that Hananiah, Mishael, and Azaria are buried alongside Daniel. |- |[[Ezra]] |[[Ezra's Tomb]], Al-'Uzayr, near [[Basra]], [[Iraq]] |[[File:Tomb of Ezra.jpg|100px]] | Preserved by Jewish caretakers until the middle of the 20th century. From that point, a local Muslim Iraqi took the responsibility of preserving the location. The area surrounding the tomb is used today as a place of Muslim worship although Hebrew inscriptions are still present in the room. Located where Tigris and Euphrates meet. |- |[[Lamech (father of Noah)|Lamech]] |Islam: Tomb of Lamech, [[Mihtarlam]], [[Afghanistan]] |[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mPIgo0ZmcTg&t=2m55s Seen here] | |- |[[Zechariah ben Jehoiada]] |[[Tomb of Zechariah]], [[Mount of Olives]], [[Jerusalem]] |[[File:Zetomb.JPG|100px]] | |} ==Figures mentioned in the New Testament== * [[Tomb of Jesus]] * [[John the Baptist]] in the [[Umayyad Mosque]] * [[Tomb of the Virgin Mary]] * [[Saint Peter's tomb]] * [[Saint Mark's Coptic Orthodox Cathedral (Alexandria)]] * [[Matthew the Apostle]] in the [[Salerno Cathedral]] * [[James, son of Zebedee]] in the [[Santiago de Compostela Cathedral]] * [[Luke the Evangelist]] in [[Thebes, Greece]] * [[Basilica of St. John]] * The so-called ''Tomb of [[Caiaphas]]'' was discovered by accident in 1990 and subsequently excavated by archaeologists.Caiaphas’ Family Tomb Found, Chicago Tribune, August 14, 1992, http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1992-08-14/news/9203130273_1_caiaphas-ossuaries-burial-cave.The Tomb of Caiaphas’ Unearthed?, The New York Times, August 16, 1992, Author Michael Specter https://www.nytimes.com/1992/08/16/weekinreview/august-9-15-the-tomb-of-caiaphas-unearthed.html. * [[Herod the Great#Tomb discovery|Tomb of Herod the Great]] (discovered in 2007 by archaeologist [[Ehud Netzer]] after 35 years of searching) * The [[Mausoleum of Augustus|Mausoleum of the Roman Emperor Augustus]] ==See also== {{commons category|Tombs and graves of saintly people in Judaism}} {{portal|Death|Lists}} *[[Burial places of founders of world religions]] *[[List of artifacts significant to the Bible]] *[[List of mausolea]] *[[Lives of the Prophets]] *[[Ohel (grave)]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Holy sites in Judaism}} [[Category:Biblical people]] [[Category:Lists of tombs|Biblical figures]] [[Category:Bible-related lists|Burial places of Biblical figures]] [[Category:Lists of burials by place|Biblical figures]] [[Category:Biblical geography]]

page.title: List of people with locked-in syndrome

revision.text:
{{main|Locked-in syndrome}} {{Horizontal TOC|nonum=y|limit=2}} ==Kate Allatt== '''Kate Allatt''' is a mother-of-three from [[Sheffield]], [[South Yorkshire]], who has successfully recovered from locked-in syndrome. She now runs Fighting Strokes and devotes her life to assisting those who have locked-in syndrome.<ref name="amazing_spirit" />
==Jean-Dominique Bauby== French journalist '''[[Jean-Dominique Bauby]]''' suffered a [[stroke]] in December 1995. When he awoke 20 days later, he found his body was almost completely paralyzed; he could control only his left eyelid (as the other was sewn shut to prevent an infection). By blinking this eye, he slowly dictated one alphabetic character at a time and, in so doing, was able over a great length of time to write his memoir, ''[[The Diving Bell and the Butterfly]]''; the memoir was adapted to the screen in a [[The Diving Bell and the Butterfly (film)|namesake 2007 movie]]. Three days after the book was published in March 1997, Bauby died from [[pneumonia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://film.avclub.com/the-diving-bell-and-the-butterfly-1798203488 |title=The Diving Bell And The Butterfly |first=Tasha |last=Robinson |date=November 29, 2007 |work=The A.V. Club |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> He was instrumental in forming the Association du Locked in Syndrome (ALIS) in [[France]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.alis-asso.fr/ |title=Association du Locked in Syndrome |language=French |location=FR |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Rabbi Ronnie Cahana== In the summer of 2011, '''Rabbi Ronnie Cahana''' of Congregation Beth-El in Montreal suffered a severe [[brainstem stroke]] that left him in a locked-in state, able to communicate only with his eyes. With his family's help he continued to write poems and sermons for his congregation, letter by letter, by blinking. He has since regained his ability to breathe by himself and speak. He describes his experiences as a blessing and a spiritual revelation of body and mind.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://rabbicahana.wordpress.com/ |title=Rabbi Ronnie Cahana |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> His story was told in a [[Ted Talk]] given by his daughter called "[https://www.ted.com/talks/kitra_cahana_my_father_locked_in_his_body_but_soaring_free My father, locked in his body but soaring free]". He is the son of painter [[Alice Lok Cahana]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mysanantonio.com/g00/news/houston-deaths/article/Alice-Lok-Cahana-artist-and-Holocaust-survivor-12417040.php |title=Alice Lok Cahana, artist and Holocaust survivor, dies at 88 |first=Marialuisa |last=Rincon |date=December 8, 2017 |newspaper=My San Antonio |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Lynsey Cribbin== '''Lynsey Cribbin''', from [[County Cavan|Cavan, Ireland]], woke up with several headaches in January 2012. She suffered multiple strokes which left her on life support and eventually with one of the most severe cases of locked-in syndrome. Her brain works but she cannot move.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Bramhill |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/irishsun/irishsunnews/4506279/Locked-in-Lynseys-care-woe-Parents-anger-at-denial-of-specialist-help.html |title=Locked-in Lynsey's care woe: Parents anger at denial of specialist help |newspaper=The Sun |date=August 27, 2012 |dead-url=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010174349/http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/irishsun/irishsunnews/4506279/Locked-in-Lynseys-care-woe-Parents-anger-at-denial-of-specialist-help.html |archive-date=October 10, 2012 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Stephen Hawking== '''[[Stephen Hawking]]''' had a progressive [[motor neuron disease]] related to [[amyotrophic lateral sclerosis]] (ALS) that began developing in the early 1960s. He was almost entirely paralyzed and communicated using a [[speech generating device]]. In 2005, as the disease progressed, he began to control his communication device with movements of his cheek muscles,{{sfn|Ferguson|2011|p=224}}<ref name="tech" /><ref name="hacked">{{cite web |url=http://cosmiclog.nbcnews.com/_news/2012/06/25/12401493-how-researchers-hacked-into-stephen-hawkings-brain |title=How researchers hacked into Stephen Hawking's brain |date=June 25, 2012 |first=Alan |last=Boyle |publisher=NBC News |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> with a rate of about one word per minute.<ref name="tech">{{cite news |url=https://www.newscientist.com/article/dn21323-the-man-who-saves-stephen-hawkings-voice/ |title=The man who saves Stephen Hawking's voice |date=December 30, 2011 |first=Catherine |last=de Lange |work=New Scientist |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> Hawking collaborated with researchers on systems that could translate his brain patterns or facial expressions into switch activations.<ref name="hacked" /><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/stephen-hawking/8989060/Stephen-Hawking-driven-by-a-cosmic-force-of-will.html |title=Stephen Hawking: driven by a cosmic force of will |first=Roger |last=Highfield |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=January 3, 2012 |publisher=[[Telegraph Media Group|TMG]] |location=London |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-18749963 |title=Start-up attempts to convert Prof Hawking's brainwaves into speech |date=July 7, 2012 |publisher=BBC |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Rom Houben== In 1983, '''[[Rom Houben]]''' survived a near-fatal car crash and was diagnosed as being in a [[vegetative state]]. Twenty-three years later, using "modern brain imaging techniques and equipment", doctors revised his diagnosis to locked-in syndrome.<ref name="guardian_houben">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/nov/23/man-trapped-coma-23-years |title=Trapped in his own body for 23 years – the coma victim who screamed unheard |last=Connolly |first=Kate |date=November 23, 2009 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=UK |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> He was initially reported as communicating by typing into a keyboard with his right hand,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2009/11/for_23_years_man_thought_to_be.html |title=For 23 Years Man Thought To Be In Coma Tried To 'Scream', And No One Heard |first=Mark |last=Memmott |work=NPR |date=November 23, 2009 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> though the presence of a [[Facilitated communication|facilitator]] to move his hand attracted sharp criticism and strong doubts that Houben's communications were authentic.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2009/11/really_this_guy_is_conscious.php |title=Really? This guy is conscious? |first=PZ |last=Myers |work=Pharyngula |date=November 24, 2009 |dead-url=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091127052139/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2009/11/really_this_guy_is_conscious.php |archive-date=November 27, 2009 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/health/comatose-for-23-years-belgian-feels-reborn/ |title=Comatose for 23 years, Belgian feels reborn |newspaper=The Seattle Times |date=November 25, 2009 |first=Raf |last=Casert |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/jacob-m-appel/the-rom-houben-tragedy-an_b_370032.html |title=The Rom Houben Tragedy And The Case For Active Euthanasia |last=Appel |first=Jacob M. |date=November 24, 2009 |newspaper=[[The Huffington Post]] |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
In early 2010, Dr. [[Steven Laureys]], Houben's neurologist, admitted that subsequent tests had demonstrated Houben had not actually been communicating via the facilitator, and ''[[Der Spiegel]]'', which had originally "quoted" many of Houben's facilitated statements, retracted those quotes as being inauthentic.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/neurological-rescue-mission-communicating-with-those-trapped-within-their-brains-a-677537.html |title=Communicating with Those Trapped within Their Brains |first=Manfred |last=Dworschak |location=DE |work=Der Spiegel |date=February 13, 2010 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> Laureys maintained the [[Magnetic resonance imaging|MRI]] data that had led him to diagnose Houben as locked-in still suggested he was conscious.
Houben's case had been thought to call into question the current methods of diagnosing vegetative state and arguments against withholding care from such patients.<ref name="guardian_houben" /><ref>{{cite journal |title=Diagnostic accuracy of the vegetative and minimally conscious state: Clinical consensus versus standardized neurobehavioral assessment |first1=Caroline |last1=Schnakers |first2=Audrey |last2=Vanhaudenhuyse |first3=Joseph |last3=Giacino |first4=Manfredi |last4=Ventura |first5=Melanie |last5=Boly |first6=Steve |last6=Majerus |first7=Gustave |last7=Moonen |first8=Steven |last8=Laureys |author8-link=Steven Laureys |journal=[[BMC Neurology]] |year=2009 |volume=9 |page=35 |doi=10.1186/1471-2377-9-35 |url=https://bmcneurol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2377-9-35 |pmid=19622138 |pmc=2718857 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Graham Miles== In 1993, '''Graham Miles''', originally from [[Sanderstead]], [[London Borough of Croydon]], suffered a [[stroke]] after which he could not move any part of his body except his eyes. His condition improved gradually, to the point that in 2010 he was able to walk with two sticks and drive a car.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/7966357/Pensioner-tells-how-he-beat-locked-in-syndrome-after-massive-stroke.html |title=Pensioner tells how he beat "locked in" syndrome after massive stroke |first=Richard |last=Alleyne |date=August 26, 2010 |work=The Daily Telegraph |access-date=November 22, 2018 |location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-dorset-11103527 |title=Locked-in syndrome man learns to walk again |date=August 26, 2010 |work=BBC News |location=UK |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Elias Musiris== In 2002, '''Elias Musiris''' made headlines as the first fully locked-in patient to regain some measure of communication through [[Electroencephalography|EEG]]. Though [[ALS]] had left Musiris unable even to move his eyes or blink, training from neurological researcher Niels Birbaumer taught him to use an EEG brain-machine interface to answer yes-or-no questions and spell his name.<ref>{{cite web |last=Keiper |first=Adam |title=The Age of Neuroelectronics |url=https://www.thenewatlantis.com/publications/the-age-of-neuroelectronics |publisher=The New Atlantis |pages=4–41 |date=Winter 2006 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Tony Nicklinson==
'''Tony Nicklinson''' was born on the 2 April 1954. Nicklinson was a rugby union player and a successful civil engineer. The 58 year old was paralysed from the neck down after suffering a stroke in 2005, he was not able to speak or move any parts of his body apart from his head and eyes. He had spent two-and-a-half years undergoing therapy in hospital before moving home in a wheelchair to be cared by his wife, Jane, and his two teenage daughters Lauren and Beth. He described his life as a “living nightmare".
Nicklinson attempted to seek a landmark ruling in the British courts which would have allowed him the right to an assisted death, but he lost the case in the [[High Court of Justice|High Court]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/health-19249680 |title=Tony Nicklinson loses High Court right-to-die case |work=BBC News |date=August 16, 2012 |first=James |last=Gallagher |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> He eventually died on 20 August 2012 at his home in Melksham, Wiltshire by refusing food. His family continued his case after his death, before it was ultimately rejected in the [[Supreme Court of the United Kingdom|Supreme Court]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Campaigners lose 'right to die' case |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/health-28016033 |work=BBC News |date=July 25, 2014 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> {{See also|R (Nicklinson) v Ministry of Justice}}
==Eoin O'Mahony== '''Eoin O'Mahony''' of [[Blarney|Blarney, Ireland]] developed headaches while studying for his [[Leaving Certificate (Ireland)|Leaving Certificate]] in 2001. Brain surgery was carried out at [[Cork University Hospital]]. Then O'Mahony entered a coma-like state. He cannot even use a finger to press a button for assistance. The [[High Court (Ireland)|High Court]] has been told that he "essentially suffers from locked-in syndrome."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.irishexaminer.com/ireland/man-with-locked-in-syndrome-due-multi-million-payout-320837.html |title=Man with locked-in syndrome due multi-million payout |date=March 28, 2015 |first=Ann |last=O'Loughlin |newspaper=[[Irish Examiner]] |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Gary Parkinson== In 2010, ex-[[Premier League|Premiership]] footballer '''[[Gary Parkinson]]''' suffered a massive stroke and was later diagnosed with locked-in syndrome.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.blackpoolgazette.co.uk/news/desperate-fight-for-pool-coach-1-2995743 |title=Desperate fight for Pool coach |date=September 18, 2010 |newspaper=The Gazette |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> This, however, has not ended his career in football, as he is now part of [[Middlesbrough F.C.]]'s scouting analysis team, watching potential players on DVD and relaying the verdict to the Middlesbrough manager [[Tony Mowbray]] solely through blinking.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/nov/22/middlesbrough-gary-parkinson-scouting-role |title=Middlesbrough hand Gary Parkinson role despite crippling condition |date=November 22, 2011 |newspaper=The Guardian |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Martin Pistorius== '''[[Martin Pistorius]]''' began developing locked-in syndrome when he was 12 years old. He went into a coma for 2–3 years, after which point he slowly regained consciousness but was unable to communicate this to others until he was around 19 years of age. Now capable of some movement and able to communicate with a [[Speech synthesis|speech computer]], Pistorius currently works as a freelance web designer/developer and has published a book about his life entitled ''Ghost Boy''.<ref>{{cite web |last=Deveney |first=Catherine |title=The Catherine Deveney Interview : Martin Pistorius : Ghost writer |url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-29177709.html |access-date=November 22, 2018 |publisher=Scotland on Sunday |date=July 17, 2011}}{{subscription required}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Martin Pistorius and Rebecca Grant |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p01lsd79 |publisher=BBC Radio London |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Hager |first=Emily B. |title=For Children Who Cannot Speak, a True Voice via Technology |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/26/technology/evolving-technology-gives-true-voices-to-children-who-cannot-speak.html |newspaper=The New York Times |date=July 26, 2012 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Tony Quan, aka Tempt One== '''[[Tempt One|Tony Quan]]''', a popular graffiti artist, was diagnosed with the nerve disorder [[Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis|ALS]] in 2003, which eventually left him fully paralyzed except for his eyes. Quan uses the technology called [[EyeWriter]] to communicate his art and has since had his work displayed in numerous art shows nationally.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://gizmodo.com/5403741/eyewriter-allows-man-to-paint-despite-paralysis |title=EyeWriter Allows Man To Paint Despite Paralysis |first=Rosa |last=Golijan |date=November 13, 2009 |work=Gizmodo}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://infosthetics.com/archives/2009/11/eyewriter_graffiti_physically_paralyzed.html |title=EyeWriter: Physically Paralyzed Artist Draws Graffiti (on Buildings) |date=November 11, 2009 |dead-url=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170704115717/http://infosthetics.com/archives/2009/11/eyewriter_graffiti_physically_paralyzed.html |archive-date=July 4, 2017 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Erik Ramsey== In 1999, 16-year-old '''Erik Ramsey''' suffered a stroke after a car accident that left him in a locked-in state. His story was profiled in an edition of ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]'' magazine in 2008.<ref name="esquire">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a4972/unspeakable-odyssey-motionless-boy-1008/ |title=The Unspeakable Odyssey of the Motionless Boy |magazine=[[Esquire Magazine]] |first=Joshua |last=Foer |date=October 2, 2008 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> Ramsey is currently working with doctors to develop a new communication system that uses a computer that, through implants in his brain, reads the electronic signals produced when he thinks certain words and sounds. At present, Ramsey is only able to communicate short and basic sounds. However, doctors believe, within a few years, Ramsey will be able to use this system to communicate words and phrases, and eventually, to "talk" normally.<ref name="esquire" /><ref>{{cite journal |url=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2784218/ |title=A Wireless Brain-Machine Interface for Real-Time Speech Synthesis |date=December 9, 2009 |doi=10.1371/journal.pone.0008218 |pmid=20011034 |pmc=2784218 |journal=PLoS One |first1=Frank H. |last1=Guenther |first2=Jonathan S. |last2=Brumberg |first3=E. Joseph |last3=Wright |first4=Alfonso |last4=Nieto-Castanon |first5=Jason A. |last5=Tourville |first6=Mikhail |last6=Panko |first7=Robert |last7=Law |first8=Steven A. |last8=Siebert |first9=Jess L. |last9=Bartels |first10=Dinal S. |last10=Andreasen |first11=Princewill |last11=Ehirim |first12=Hui |last12=Mao |first13=Philip R. |last13=Kennedy |editor-first=Eshel |editor-last=Ben-Jacob |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://archive.boston.com/news/local/articles/2008/07/27/out_of_silence_the_sounds_of_hope/?page=full |title=Out of silence, the sounds of hope |first==S.I. |last=Rosenbaum |newspaper=The Boston Globe |date=July 27, 2008 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Julia Tavalaro== In 1966, '''Julia Tavalaro''', then aged 32, suffered two strokes and a brain hemorrhage and was sent to Goldwater Memorial Hospital on [[Roosevelt Island, New York]]. For six years, she was believed to be in a [[vegetative state]]. In 1972, a family member noticed her trying to smile after she heard a joke. After alerting doctors, a speech therapist, Arlene Kratt, discerned cognizance in her eye movements. Kratt and another therapist, Joyce Sabari, were eventually able to convince doctors she was in a locked-in state. After learning to communicate with eye blinks in response to letters being pointed to on an alphabet board, she became a poet and author. Eventually, she gained the ability to move her head enough to touch a switch with her cheek, which operated a motorized wheelchair and a computer. She gained national attention in 1995 when Richard E. Meyer of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' published a cover story about Tavalaro. In 1997, Erika Duncan's profile of Tavalaro and her co-author Richard Tayson, "Decades After Silence, a Voice Is Recognized," ran in the Long Island edition of ''[[The New York Times]]''<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1997/01/19/nyregion/decades-after-silence-a-voice-is-recognized.html |title=Decades After Silence, A Voice Is Recognized |first=Erika |last=Duncan |date=January 19, 1997 |access-date=November 22, 2018 |newspaper=The New York Times}}</ref> and in April 1997, "The Long Road Home" appeared in ''Newsday''.<ref>{{cite news |title=The Long Road Home |newspaper=Newsday |date=April 1997}}</ref> Tavalaro appears with Richard Tayson on ''Dateline NBC'' and Melissa Etheridge's Beyond Chance (Lifetime). Their book was published by Viking-Penguin in 1998 and was translated into German, where it was published as Bis auf den Grund des Ozeans by Verlag Herder. Tavalaro's story became a bestseller in Germany. She died on December 19, 2003 at the age of 68.<ref name="esquire" /><ref>{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/2003/dec/21/local/me-tavalaro21 |title=Julia Tavalaro, 68; Poet and Author Noted for Defying Severe Paralysis |newspaper=Los Angeles Times |page=B16 |date=December 21, 2003 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Christine Waddell== '''Christine Waddell''' is Britain's longest survivor of locked-in syndrome, which left her in a state of constant paralysis, but awareness. At the age of 26 in April 1997, she fell in her bathroom. She tried to get up but ultimately fell again and lay there for three days – until a colleague noticed her absence from work and her father broke into her [[Apartment|flat]]. Seventeen months in the hospital followed before she moved in with her parents. After years of suffering she was given a grant for a computer which allows her to communicate. She is now able to use the Internet and to communicate with old friends and others who have locked-in syndrome. She also listens to music and audiobooks, is able to swallow melted chocolate, and sometimes has occasional vodka via her feeding tube. She misses most the ability to talk and regrets being unable to eat burgers. In 2013 she ate for the first time in 17 years. She now stands with less support, reaching on a bench, holding her head up alone, and can ride a stationary bike in physiotherapy.<ref name=amazing_spirit>{{cite news |first=Jenna |last=Sloan |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/archives/reallife/906764/im-mad-on-facebook-shopping-50-shades-of-grey-and-i-like-vodka/ |title=I'm mad on Facebook, shopping, 50 Shades of Grey and I like vodka |newspaper=The Sun |date=September 11, 2012 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
==Cases in literature==
===''The Count of Monte Cristo''=== The character of M. Noirtier de Villefort in [[Alexandre Dumas]]' novel ''[[The Count of Monte Cristo]]'' (1844) apparently suffers from locked-in syndrome. He is described as a "corpse with living eyes", who communicates with eye movements and expressions. His granddaughter Valentine helps him form sentences by reciting the alphabet and scanning dictionary pages with her finger until he indicates which letters and words he wants.
===''A Song of Ice and Fire''=== In the first novel ''[[A Game of Thrones]]'', the character [[Khal Drogo]] succumbs into a vegetative state after suffering [[septicemia]] countered by [[blood magic]], resulting in complete paralysis. Though he is able to move his eyes along the orbit of the sun, he is implied to be blind and that he can sense it only because of the heat. His wife, [[Daenerys Targaryen|Daenerys]], ultimately suffocates him out of pity.
===''Thérèse Raquin''=== In [[Émile Zola]]'s novel ''[[Thérèse Raquin]]'' (1867), Thérèse Raquin and her second husband Laurent accidentally reveal to Thérèse's aunt, Madame Raquin (who has suffered from locked-in syndrome after a stroke), that they have murdered Camille Raquin (Madame Raquin's son). One day, when some friends are over, Madame Raquin eventually musters an enormous amount of strength to move her finger on a table, tracing words that would reveal Thérèse and Laurent's deed. However, she is interrupted, and her words are misinterpreted as "Thérèse and Laurent have taken good care of me".
===''Johnny Got His Gun''=== ''[[Johnny Got His Gun]]'' (1938) is a novel by American author and screenwriter [[Dalton Trumbo]], which describes a young American soldier who loses both his arms, his legs, and his face in [[World War I]]. This novel portrays "how it might feel to be totally locked-in", but it is not a true case of "locked-in syndrome", according to the [[World Health Organization|WHO]] definition. Johnny attempts to communicate with the outside world using [[Morse code]] through his eyelids and weakly chanting "[[SOS]] Help me".
===''The Ultimate Secret''=== The character of Jean-Louis Martin in [[Bernard Werber]]'s sci-fi novel ''L'Ultime Secret'' (2001),<ref>{{cite book |first=Bernard |last=Werber |title=L'Ultime Secret |year=2001 |ISBN =2-226-12740-2 |trans-title=The Ultimate Secret}}</ref> suffers from locked-in syndrome after being paralyzed in a car accident. Able at first only communicate by blinking – once for "Yes" and twice for "No" – with the use of high tech, he eventually gains control not only over his own mind, but that of others.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://frenchpubagency.com/Title-199045-Fiction-Literature/L-Ultime-Secret.html |title=L'Ultime Secret |work=The French Publisher's Agency |dead-url=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120702030008/http://frenchpubagency.com/Title-199045-Fiction-Literature/L-Ultime-Secret.html |archive-date=July 2, 2012 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
===''Locked In''=== Sharon McCone, the protagonist of [[Marcia Muller]]'s suspense novel ''Locked In'' (2009), is the founder of a successful San Francisco detective agency. On returning to her office late one night, she is shot in the head. She wakes up in a hospital able to move only her eyes, forced to struggle to rehabilitate herself while finding the attacker.<ref>{{cite book |title=Locked In |first=Marcia |last=Muller |author-link=Marcia Muller |year=2009 |publisher=Grand Central Publishing |isbn=9780446581059}}</ref>
===''Sleepyhead''=== [[Mark Billingham]]'s novel ''Sleepyhead'' (2013)<ref>{{cite book |title=Sleepyhead |first=Mark |last=Billingham |isbn=9780802193261 |publisher=Grove/Atlantic, Inc |year=2013 |series=Tom Thorne Series, #1}}</ref> addresses a criminal who purposely manipulates pressure points on each victim's head and neck with the intention of inducing locked-in syndrome.<ref>{{cite web |website=BN.com |title=Publisher's description of ''Sleepyhead'' |url=https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/sleepyhead-mark-billingham/1103371749 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
===''The Diving Bell and the Butterfly''=== <!-- [[WP:NFCC]] violation: [[File:Jean-Dominique Bauby.jpg|thumb|Bauby on "dictating" the book through blinking]] --> The book ''[[The Diving Bell and the Butterfly]]'' is a memoir by journalist [[Jean-Dominique Bauby]]. It describes what his life is like after suffering a massive stroke that left him with locked-in syndrome. It also details what his life was like before the stroke.<ref>{{cite book |title=The Diving Bell and the Butterfly |first=Jean-Dominique |last=Bauby |author-link=Jean-Dominique Bauby |language=French |publisher=Éditions Robert Laffont |year=1997 |isbn=978-0-375-40115-2}}</ref>
===''Lock In''=== [[John Scalzi]]'s science fiction police procedural [[Lock In]] is based on a society where large numbers have the locked-in-like Haden's Syndrome due to a pandemic, and are able to interact with the world through [[brain-computer interface|BCI]]-controlled bodies.<ref>{{cite book |title=Lock In |publisher=Tor Books |first=John |last=Scalzi |author-link=John Scalzi |year=2014 |isbn=978-0-7653-7586-5}}</ref>
===''Lamikorda''=== In D. R. Merrill's 2014 science-fiction novel, the Alplai virologist and epidemiologist Gihuunak appears to have a form of locked-in syndrome, being confined to a motorized wheelchair and using a [[Speech synthesis|speech computer]] to communicate.<ref>{{cite book |title=Lamikorda |first=D. R. |last=Merrill |publisher=CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform |year=2014 |isbn=9781499346350}}</ref>
==Cases in popular culture==
===''Alfred Hitchcock Presents''=== In season 1, episode 7 of ''[[Alfred Hitchcock Presents]]'', titled "Breakdown" (November 13, 1955 on CBS),<ref>{{cite episode |title=Breakdown |url=http://www.tv.com/shows/alfred-hitchcock-presents/breakdown-40906/ |date=November 13, 1955 |series=Alfred Hitchcock Presents |network=CBS |season=1 |episode=7 |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref> the sole survivor of a violent collision ([[Joseph Cotten]]) finds himself in a locked-in state, unable even to move an eyelid. The viewer experiences the victim's point of view, "hearing" his thoughts and feelings as they run from shock to anger to frustration to the realization that he may be put in his grave alive.<ref>{{cite web |title=Alfred Hitchcock Presents - Breakdown |url=https://the.hitchcock.zone/wiki/Alfred_Hitchcock_Presents_-_Breakdown |website=HitchcockWiki.com |access-date=November 22, 2018}}</ref>
===''Criminal Minds''=== In the ''Criminal Minds'' episode "The Uncanny Valley", the [[Person of interest|unsub]] Samantha Malcolm induces locked-in syndrome using a series of drugs in three women. Her reason is she is trying to complete a series of dolls she lost as a young girl. Every two months, a woman will die as the stress wreaks havoc on the body. Only one woman, who has diabetes, is able to counteract the drugs and fight off her locked-in syndrome. The episode "To Bear Witness" also use locked-in syndrome after a man falls into locked-in syndrome after surviving a botched [[lobotomy]] and communicates to Derek ([[Shemar Moore]]) through blinks.<ref>{{cite episode |title=The Uncanny Valley |series=Criminal Minds |season=5 |number=12 |date=January 13, 2010}}</ref>
===''CSI: New York''=== The ''[[CSI: NY]]'' episode "Blink" presented an instance of locked-in syndrome wherein a woman (portrayed by Jewel Christian) was sedated by the killer, who applied pressure to certain points on her head, resulting in her paralysis. The killer's previous attempts resulted in his victims' dying.<ref>{{cite episode |url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CSI:_NY_(season_1)#Episodes |title=Blink |season=1 |number=1 |series=CSI: NY}}</ref>
===''House M.D.''=== The ''[[House (TV series)|House M.D.]]'' episode "[[Locked In (House)|Locked In]]" presented a case of locked-in syndrome, which later turned into a case of total locked-in syndrome; the patient was portrayed by [[Mos Def]].<ref>{{cite episode |title=[[Locked In (House)|Locked In]] |series=[[House (TV series)|House M.D.]] |season=5 |number=19 |date=March 30, 2009}}</ref>
===''Scrubs''=== In the ''[[Scrubs (TV series)|Scrubs]]'' episode "His Story III", a patient (played by Henry LeBlanc) is presented with locked-in syndrome.<ref>{{cite episode |series=[[Scrubs (TV series)|Scrubs]] |title=His Story III |url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scrubs_(season_5)#Episodes |season=5 |number=19 |date=April 18, 2006}}</ref>
===''Star Trek''=== In the ''[[Star Trek]]'' episode "[[The Menagerie (Star Trek: The Original Series)|The Menagerie]]", Star Fleet captain Christopher Pike (played by [[Jeffrey Hunter]] when healthy, and [[Sean Kenney (actor)|Sean Kenney]] when injured) is severely burned, completely paralyzed, and can communicate only by brain waves; he can operate an electrical wheelchair and can answer yes/no questions by "one flash for yes, two flashes for no". This episode aired in November 1966; the first actual such interface was done by Fetz at the University of Washington in 1969, as noted in [[brain–computer interface]].
==="Ted Talks"=== On the [[Ted Talk]] website a talk was posted about the story of one family's journey with a brainstem stroke called: [http://www.ted.com/talks/kitra_cahana_my_father_locked_in_his_body_but_soaring_free "My Father, Locked-in his Body but Soaring Free"]. Another talk was given about graffiti artist TEMPT and the open source eye tracking device that was developed for him by his friends. [http://www.ted.com/talks/mick_ebeling_the_invention_that_unlocked_a_locked_in_artist?language=en "The Invention That Unlocked A Locked In Artist"]
